item.title: Victoria add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "Never fear quarrels, but seek hazardous adventures." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "These woods are lovely, dark and deep, But I have promises to keep, And miles to go before I sleep, And miles to go before I sleep." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Christopher Marlowe
item.description: "He that loves pleasure must for pleasure fall." -- Christopher Marlowe

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Christopher Marlowe
item.description: "Fools that will laugh on earth, most weep in hell." -- Christopher Marlowe

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Everything must be made as simple as possible. But not simpler." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "A question that sometimes drives me hazy: am I or are the others crazy?" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "I keep six honest serving men (they taught me all i knew); Theirs names are What and Why and When And How And Where and Who." -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
Victoria add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "There are no rules here -- we're trying to accomplish something." -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "If you make a mistake and do not correct it, this is called a mistake." -- Confucius

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Why is it no one sent me yet one perfect limousine, do you suppose? Ah no, it's always just my luck to get one perfect rose." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Jack London
item.description: "I would rather be ashes than dust! I would rather that my spark should burn out in a brilliant blaze than it should be stifled by dry-rot. I would rather be a superb meteor, every atom of me in magnificent glow, than a sleepy and permanent planet. The function of man is to live, not to exist. I shall not waste my days trying to prolong them. I shall use my time." -- Jack London

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Marjane Satrapi
item.description: "In life you'll meet a lot of jerks. If they hurt you, tell yourself that it's because they're stupid. That will help keep you from reacting to their cruelty. Because there is nothing worse than bitterness and vengeance... Always keep your dignity and be true to yourself." -- Marjane Satrapi

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I was gratified to be able to answer promptly, and I did. I said I didn’t know." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Victoria add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description:
"THE FIRST TEN LIES THEY TELL YOU IN HIGH SCHOOL
1. We are here to help you. 2. You will have time to get to your class before the bell rings. 3. The dress code will be enforced. 4. No smoking is allowed on school grounds. 5. Our football team will win the championship this year. 6. We expect more of you here. 7. Guidance counselors are always available to listen. 8. Your schedule was created with you in mind. 9. Your locker combination is private. 10. These will be the years you look back on fondly.
TEN MORE LIES THEY TELL YOU IN HIGH SCHOOL
1. You will use algebra in your adult lives. 2. Driving to school is a privilege that can be taken away. 3. Students must stay on campus during lunch. 4. The new text books will arrive any day now. 5. Colleges care more about you than your SAT scores. 6. We are enforcing the dress code. 7. We will figure out how to turn off the heat soon. 8. Our bus drivers are highly trained professionals. 9. There is nothing wrong with summer school. 10. We want to hear what you have to say." -- Laurie Halse Anderson
